reactions.text: When an unconscious creature the hag can see within 30 feet of her regains consciousness, the hag can force the creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage, and the hag regains hit points equal to the amount of damage taken.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drider has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the drider knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

multiAttack.text: The drider makes three attacks, using Foreleg or Poison Burst in any combination.

attacks.name: Foreleg
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

attacks.name: Poison Burst
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range 120 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Poison damage.

bonusActions.name: Magic of the Spider Queen (Recharge 56)
bonusActions.text: The drider casts Darkness, Faerie Fire, or Web, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

spellcasting.name: Magic of the Spider Queen (Recharge 56)
headerEntries: The drider casts Darkness, Faerie Fire, or Web, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

name: Dragonflesh Abomination
languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Cloying Miasma
traits.text: The abomination is surrounded by a noxious stench. At the start of the abomination's turn, any creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the abomination's next turn.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The abomination regains 10 hit points at the start of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

multiAttack.text: The abomination makes three attacks using Claw, Acidic Spit, or a combination of them. It can replace one of the attacks with a Tail attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Acidic Spit
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) acid damage.

special.name: Acid Belch
special.text: The abomination belches forth a cloud of acidic gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its magical essence lashes out as a ball of lightning at the closest creature within 30 feet of it before arcing out to up to two other creatures within 15 feet of the first. Each creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes three Rend or Energy Ray attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Energy Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

special.name: Noxious Breath
special.text: The draconian exhales a 15-foot cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 (6d6) poison damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, doesn't gain exhaustion, and is immune to all draconians' Noxious Breath for 24 hours.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: invisibility, mage hand 2/day each: dimension door, disguise self, sending

reactions.name: Magic Shield (3/Day)
reactions.text: When the draconian is hit by an attack roll, it can create an invisible barrier of magical force around itself, granting it a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack and potentially causing the attack to miss.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dandylion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The dandylion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dandylion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The dandylion makes one Bite attack and one Claws attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) slashing damage. If the dandylion moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the dandylion can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

special.name: Rejuvenating Seedpods (2/Day)
special.text: The dandylion releases a burst of seedpods from its tail, filling a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature of the dandylion's choice in the sphere can immediately end one of the following conditions on itself (creature's choice): blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. In addition, all soil in the sphere's area is enriched, restoring withered vegetation in the area to full health and causing all crops in the area to produce twice the normal harvest for the next year.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dandylion casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: druidcraft, guidance, purify food and drink once per day: speak with plants 2/day each: entangle, goodberry

reactions.name: Roar of Pride
reactions.text: When a creature within 60 feet of the dandylion hits it with an attack roll, the dandylion can unleash a furious roar. The creature that triggered this reaction must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until the end of the dandylion's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dandylion casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

multiAttack.text: The chimera makes one Ram attack, one Bite attack, and one Claw attack. It can replace the Claw attack with a use of Fire Breath if available.

attacks.name: Bite

conditional.condition: the chimera had Advantage on the attack roll

attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage, or 18 (4d6 + 4) Piercing damage if the chimera had Advantage on the attack roll.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. Failure: 31 (7d8) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.text: If the cerodon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the cerodon can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The cerodon deals double damage to objects and structures.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The krasis can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The krasis makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Aura of Command
traits.text: The draconian radiates a commanding presence in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. A draconian in the aura that can see or hear the aurak can't be charmed and has advantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the frightened condition on itself.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its magical essence lashes out as a ball of lightning at the closest creature within 30 feet of it before arcing out to up to two other creatures within 15 feet of the first. Each creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes three Rend or Energy Ray attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Energy Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

special.name: Noxious Breath
special.text: The draconian exhales a 15-foot cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 (6d6) poison damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, doesn't gain exhaustion, and is immune to all draconians' Noxious Breath for 24 hours.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: invisibility, mage hand once per day: dominate person 2/day each: dimension door, disguise self, sending

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

multiAttack.text: The annis makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Crushing Hug
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hag's turns. The hag can't make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The hag casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): 3/day each: disguise self (including the form of a Medium Humanoid), Fog cloud

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

3e: disguise self (including the form of a Medium Humanoid)

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: If destroyed, the tile creature regains all its hit points and becomes active again in 24 hours unless at least half its tiles are collected and kept separate from the rest of the creature's tiles.

multiAttack.text: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Horns
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: The dragon head exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Narrow Dodge
reactions.text: When targeted by a melee attack, the tile creature can take a reaction to turn its narrowest aspect toward the attacker. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The yuan-ti makes three Bite attacks or two Spectral Fangs attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Spectral Fangs
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) poison damage.

special.name: Merrshaulk's Slumber (1/Day)
special.text: The yuan-ti targets up to five creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or fall into a magical sleep and be unconscious for 10 minutes. A sleeping target awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. This magical sleep has no effect on a creature immune to being charmed.

special.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
special.text: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: animal friendship (snakes only), guidance, mage hand, message 3 times per day: suggestion 2/day each: hold person, invisibility

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
headerEntries: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

traits.name: Heat Aura
traits.text: At the end of each of the remorhaz's turns, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the remorhaz takes 11 (2d10) Fire damage.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) Fire damage.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.text: If the baloth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the baloth can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The whirlwyrm can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The whirlwyrm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the whirlwyrm can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the whirlwyrm. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

multiAttack.text: The werebear makes two attacks, using Handaxe or Rend in any combination. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a Werebear under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points. Success: The target is immune to this werebear's curse for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Handaxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Rend (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The werebear shape-shifts into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid form or a Large bear, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The umber hulk can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

multiAttack.text: The umber hulk makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Confusing Gaze
bonusActions.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: The target can't take Reactions until the start of the umber hulk's next turn, and the target rolls 1d8 to determine what it does on its next turn:

name: Trinket
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

traits.name: Chosen Companion
traits.text: Trinket has an additional 10 hit points, and has a +6 bonus to attack and damage rolls and to Wisdom (Perception) checks.

traits.name: Empowered Attacks
traits.text: Trinket's attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to damage from nonmagical attacks.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: Trinket has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Raven's Slumber
traits.text: If Trinket is reduced to 0 hit points and is within 100 feet of Vex, he is immediately drawn into the demiplane within Vex's raven's slumber and stabilized.

multiAttack.text: Trinket makes two attacks: one with his bite and one with his claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d8 + 10) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d6 + 10) slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The triceratops makes two Gore attacks.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) Piercing damage. If the target is Huge or smaller and the triceratops moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The draconian has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Controlled Fall
traits.text: If the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 50 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: If the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its body erupts into sludge that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere. Each creature within that area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in the sludge for 1 minute. While covered in the sludge, a creature's speed is halved. A creature can use its action to scrape the sludge off itself or another creature within 5 feet of itself.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

special.name: Flaming Carnage
special.text: The draconian indulges its rage, wreathing itself in fire and moving up to its speed. The draconian can enter creatures' spaces during this move. During this movement, when the draconian enters a creature's space, the creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) fire damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest space out of the draconian's path. A creature can be affected by this draconian's Flaming Carnage only once during a turn.

reactions.name: Violent Retaliation
reactions.text: If a creature within 10 feet of the draconian hits it with an attack, the draconian can make one Claw attack against that creature. If the Claw attack hits, it deals an additional 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The tlincalli makes one Longsword or Spiked Chain attack and one Sting attack.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

attacks.name: Spiked Chain
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tlincalli can't use the spiked chain against another target.

attacks.name: Sting
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.text: The titanothere is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the titanothere moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition if it is a creature.

multiAttack.text: The thri-kreen makes two Gythka attacks or four Psychic Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Gythka
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Psychic Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) psychic damage.

special.name: Drain Vitality (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The thri-kreen targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 32 (5d12) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The thri-kreen regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The thri-kreen casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability: At will: levitate (self only), mage hand (the hand is invisible) 1/day each: freedom of movement (self only), invisibility (self only)

bonusActions.name: Chameleon Carapace
bonusActions.text: The thri-kreen changes the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings, gaining advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes to hide in those surroundings.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The thri-kreen casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 16). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The mimic attacks three times: twice with its pseudopods and once with its bite.

attacks.name: Pseudopods
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

special.name: Spit Acid
special.text: The mimic spits acid at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 32 (9d6 + 1) acid damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

attacks.name: Flipper
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the whale. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the whale. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.text: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The roper can use its action to polymorph into a stone object or back to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

multiAttack.text: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Tendril
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

special.name: Reel
special.text: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The sea lion can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The sea lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The sea lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sea lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Swimming Leap
traits.text: With a 10-foot swimming start, the sea lion can long jump out of or across the water up to 25 feet.

multiAttack.text: The sea lion makes three attacks: one bite attack and two claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The sailback can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The sailback makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the sailback can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the sailback. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Ruinous Acid
traits.text: Any nonmagical weapon that hits the spider corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the spider is destroyed after dealing damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

multiAttack.text: The spider makes two Ruinous Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Web.

attacks.name: Ruinous Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) acid damage. In addition, if the target is a creature wearing nonmagical armor, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an Armor Class of 10 is destroyed.

attacks.name: Web
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target has the restrained condition. As an action, a restrained target can make a DC 13 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a successful check. The webbing can also be destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to acid, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

traits.name: Card Sense
traits.text: The riffler can smell the presence of magical cards, including Decks of Many Things and other magical decks, within 1 mile of itself. It knows the direction to any such cards in that range. Effects that protect a target from divination magic block this sense.

traits.name: Riffling Step
traits.text: The riffler can burrow through any nonmagical material that isn't iron, shuffling the substance through which the riffler moves aside like cards to form a tunnel that closes behind the riffler.

multiAttack.text: The riffler makes two Spectral Card attacks.

attacks.name: Spectral Card
attacks.text: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage plus 5 (1d10) damage that is radiant if the d10 roll is an even number and necrotic if it's odd.

special.name: Card Spray
special.text: The riffler magically unleashes a spray of spectral cards in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (5d10) force damage and has the restrained condition for 1 minute as cards bind it. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Plane Shift
special.text: The riffler casts the Plane Shift spell targeting only itself, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

reactions.name: Shuffle Destiny
reactions.text: When a creature the riffler can see within 30 feet of itself makes an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, the riffler can magically force that creature to roll a d6 and either add the number rolled to the total or subtract it from the total (riffler's choice), potentially changing the outcome.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The pixie has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The pixie makes two Faerie Dust attacks.

attacks.name: Faerie Dust
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Radiant damage, and the target has the Charmed or Poisoned condition (pixie's choice) until the start of the pixie's next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The pixie casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Dancing Lights, Druidcraft, Invisibility (self only) 1/day each: Detect Thoughts, Fly, Major Image

bonusActions.name: Burst of Wonder (Recharge 56)
bonusActions.text: The pixie casts Entangle, Polymorph, or Tasha's Hideous Laughter, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

spellcasting.name: Burst of Wonder (Recharge 56)
headerEntries: The pixie casts Entangle, Polymorph, or Tasha's Hideous Laughter, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The scavver doesn't require air.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature that is missing any hit points), reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) piercing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Silver Spear
traits.text: A character within 5 feet of the shark can use an action to try to dislodge the spear, doing so with a successful DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check. While the spear is lodged in the shark, the shark glows with silvery illumination, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the shark misses, it can use a bonus action to swim up to 25 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.text: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) fire damage.

attacks.name: Tendril
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) fire damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target. A creature takes 4 (1d8) fire damage each time it ends its turn grappled by the roper.

special.name: Reel
special.text: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

multiAttack.text: The manticore makes two attacks, one with its bite and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Stinger
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Magic Sense
traits.text: The hunter knows the location of every spellcaster, active spell, and magic item within 120 feet of itself.

traits.name: Spider Climb (Hunter Form Only)
traits.text: The hunter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The hunter makes two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw (Hunter Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the hunter can't make a Tail attack against another target.

special.name: Mage Tracker (Sentry Form Only)
special.text: The hunter emits a pulse of energy that helps it better locate its magical quarry. Each creature within 120 feet of the hunter that has the ability to cast spells must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be mystically marked by the hunter for 1 hour. While marked, a creature can't become hidden from the hunter and gains no benefit from the invisible condition against the hunter. Additionally, while a marked creature is on the same plane of existence as the hunter, the hunter always knows the distance and direction to the creature.

bonusActions.name: Shift Form
bonusActions.text: The hunter folds into its drone-like sentry form or unfolds into its hunter form. Its game statistics are the same in each form.

reactions.name: Consume and Destroy

components.target: Dexterity saving throw or take the other half of the damage

reactions.text: When the hunter takes damage from a spell, it takes only half the triggering damage (rounded down). If the creature that cast the spell is within 60 feet of the hunter, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take the other half of the damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

multiAttack.text: The kruthik makes two Stab or Spike attacks.

attacks.name: Stab
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Spike
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

special.name: Acid Spray
special.text: The kruthik sprays acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The priest can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The priest makes two Thunderous Touch or Thunderbolt attacks.

attacks.name: Thunderous Touch
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d10) thunder damage.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage, and the target is knocked prone.

special.name: Voice of the Kraken (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: A kraken speaks through the priest with a thunderous voice audible within 300 feet. Creatures of the priest's choice that can hear the kraken's words (which are spoken in Abyssal, Infernal, or Primordial) must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the priest for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: command, create or destroy water once per day: Evard's black tentacles 3/day each: control water, darkness, water breathing, water walk

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Fiendish Blessing
traits.text: The AC of Isolde includes her Charisma bonus.

traits.name: Magic Resistance Aura
traits.text: While holding Nepenthe, Isolde creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around her. While this aura is active, Isolde and all creatures friendly to her in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: Isolde's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). Isolde can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: once per day: plane shift (self only) 3/day each: alter self, command, detect magic

multiAttack.text: Isolde makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

attacks.name: Nepenthe

conditional.condition: used with two hands to make a melee attack

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft.., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage, or 12 (1d10 + 7) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a fiend or an undead, it takes an extra 11 (2d10) radiant damage.

attacks.name: Fire Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage.

special.name: Fiendish Charm
special.text: One humanoid Isolde can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys Isolde's spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from Isolde or another creature or receives a suicidal command from Isolde, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Isolde's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Isolde's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). Isolde can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The crab can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Shell Camouflage
traits.text: While the crab remains motionless with its eyestalks and pincers tucked close to its body, it resembles a natural formation or a pile of detritus. A creature within 30 feet of it can discern its true nature with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Nature) check.

multiAttack.text: The crab makes two attacks with its claws.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.text: A creature that touches the hellion or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Luring Maestro
traits.text: While within 60 feet of the matriarch, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the matriarch's Luring Song.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The matriarch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The matriarch makes two claws attacks.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage.

special.name: Fleeting Form
special.text: The matriarch can magically disguise itself to resemble a humanoid of roughly similar size and shape for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. This illusion does not hold up to close scrutiny.

special.name: Luring Song
special.text: The matriarch sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the matriarch that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the song ends. The matriarch must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the matriarch is incapacitated. While charmed by the matriarch, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the matriarch, the target must move on its turn toward the matriarch by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the matriarch, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to this matriarch's song for the next 24 hours.

special.name: Visage of Desire (1/Day)
special.text: The matriarch projects a vision into the minds of creatures within 30 feet of it that aren't constructs or undead, showing each creature achieving whatever it most desires. An affected creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the gomazoa remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.text: The gomazoa can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the gomazoa, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The gomazoa can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The gomazoa makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Tendril
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the gomazoa can't use the same tendril on another target.

special.name: Reel
special.text: The gomazoa pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

multiAttack.text: The shark makes two Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9 (with Advantage if the target doesn't have all its Hit Points), reach 5 ft. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Piercing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The crocodile can hold its breath for 1 hour.

multiAttack.text: The crocodile makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition and can't be targeted by the crocodile's Tail.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

multiAttack.text: The axe beak makes one Sharpened Beak attack and one Talons attack.

attacks.name: Sharpened Beak
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) Slashing damage, and a creature within 5 feet of the target (axe beak's choice) takes 6 (1d12) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Talons
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

name: Gem Stalker
languages: telepathy 60 ft. understands Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The gem stalker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The gem stalker doesn't require food or drink.

multiAttack.text: The gem stalker makes four Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Crystal Dart
bonusActions.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) force damage, and one of the following effects occurs, determined by the kind of dragon that created the gem stalker:

bonusActions.name: Amethyst
bonusActions.text: The gem stalker can teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it.

bonusActions.name: Crystal
bonusActions.text: The gem stalker gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

bonusActions.name: Emerald
bonusActions.text: The target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the next attack roll it makes before the start of the gem stalker's next turn.

bonusActions.name: Sapphire
bonusActions.text: The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be pushed horizontally up to 10 feet away from the gem stalker and be knocked prone.

bonusActions.name: Topaz
bonusActions.text: The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the gem stalker's next turn.

reactions.name: Protective Link
reactions.text: When another creature the gem stalker can see within 30 feet of it is about to take damage, the gem stalker reduces that damage by 10 (3d6). The gem stalker then takes damage equal to that amount.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The lizard can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The lizard makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizard can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the lizard. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the egg hunter is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the egg hunter move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the egg hunter is animate. Dragons have disadvantage on this check.

multiAttack.text: The egg hunter makes two Barbed Proboscis attacks, and it can use Torpor Spores if it's available.

attacks.name: Barbed Proboscis
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the egg hunter regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

special.name: Torpor Spores
special.text: The egg hunter releases a billow of sparkling blue spores. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the egg hunter must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both, and it can't take reactions. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this egg hunter's Torpor Spores for the next 24 hours.

reactions.name: Rapid Adaptation
reactions.text: When the egg hunter takes damage, it gives itself resistance to that damage.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.text: The dread doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The dread doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium Humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.text: If the dread doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 17 (5d6) damage from the attack.

multiAttack.text: The dread doppelganger makes three Slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6).

special.name: Read Thoughts
special.text: The dread doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 ft. of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the dread doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the dread doppelganger's Concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dread doppelganger casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): 2 times per day: phantasmal killer 1/day each: mirror image, mislead

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dread doppelganger casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.text: If the ceratops moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the ceratops can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage

traits.name: Stench
traits.text: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

special.name: Death Ray
special.text: The catoblepas targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

multiAttack.text: The bulette makes two Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage.

special.name: Deadly Leap
special.text: The bulette spends 5 feet of movement to jump to a space within 15 feet that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in the bulette's destination space. Failure: 19 (3d12) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage, and the target is pushed 5 feet straight away from the bulette.

bonusActions.name: Leap
bonusActions.text: The bulette jumps up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

name: Banderhobb
languages: understands Common and the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Resonant Connection
traits.text: If the banderhobb has even a tiny piece of a creature or an object in its possession, such as a lock of hair or a splinter of wood, it knows the most direct route to that creature or object if it is within 1 mile of the banderhobb.

multiAttack.text: The banderhobb makes one Bite attack and one Tongue attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Shadow Step.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the banderhobb can't use its Bite attack or Tongue attack on another target.

attacks.name: Tongue
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled to a space within 5 feet of the banderhobb.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature grappled by the banderhobb. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage. The creature is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the banderhobb, and it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the banderhobb's turns. A creature reduced to 0 hit points in this way stops taking the necrotic damage and becomes stable.

special.name: Shadow Step
special.text: The banderhobb teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of dim light or darkness that it can see.

bonusActions.name: Shadow Stealth
bonusActions.text: While in dim light or darkness, the banderhobb takes the Hide action.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.text: If the baloth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the baloth can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If Aphemia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Aphemia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Aphemia makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

special.name: Discordant Song
special.text: Aphemia shrieks a cacophony of magical sounds. Each humanoid within 120 feet of her must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her until the song ends. A frightened creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage at the start of its turn while Aphemia is singing. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Aphemia's Discordant Song for the next 24 hours. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

special.name: Grave Calling Song
special.text: Aphemia intones a low, growling magical melody. Every undead within 300 feet of her must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall under her control until the song ends. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing, and she can mentally command the undead under her control as part of the same bonus action. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The ammit can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The ammit makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ammit can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the ammit. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The achaierai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The achaierai makes two attacks with its Talons and one attack with its Beak.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Talons
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Spring Attack
bonusActions.text: The achaierai takes the Disengage action.

reactions.name: Defensive Cloud
reactions.text: After taking damage the achaierai can use its reaction to release a cloud of poisonous gas in a 10-foot-radius. All creatures in the cloud take 7 (2d6) poison damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned the target is confused as if from a confusion spell. At the end of its turns, the affected target can repeat the Constitution saving throw. If it succeeds the confusion ends. Achaierai are immune to the effects of this cloud.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The yuan-ti makes one Constrict attack and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The yuan-ti can constrict only one creature at a time.

attacks.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Spectral Fangs
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

special.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if concentrating on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

special.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
special.text: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: animal friendship (snakes only), mage hand, message, prestidigitation 3 times per day: suggestion 2/day each: darkness, fear

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
headerEntries: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sseth's Blessing
traits.text: When the yuan-ti reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the yuan-ti gains 9 temporary hit points.

multiAttack.text: The yuan-ti makes two Bite attacks and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Spectral Fangs
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
special.text: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: animal friendship (snakes only), message, minor illusion, prestidigitation 3 times per day: suggestion 2/day each: detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
headerEntries: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

name: Yeth Hound
languages: understands Common, Elvish and Sylvan but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

traits.name: Sunlight Banishment
traits.text: If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, whereupon it typically sets out to find its pack or its master. The hound is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. Once it is adjacent to its master or a pack mate that is on the Material Plane, a yeth hound in the Border Ethereal can return to the Material Plane as an action.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.text: While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

special.name: Baleful Baying
special.text: The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the hound until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.text: The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: The yakfolk is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy 1st level (4 slots): bane, command, cure wounds, sanctuary 2nd level (3 slots): augury, hold person, spiritual weapon 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, protection from energy, sending 4th level (1 slot): banishment

multiAttack.text: The yakfolk makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Quarterstaff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

special.name: Summon Earth Elemental (1/Day)
special.text: The yakfolk summons an earth elemental. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of the summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The yakfolk is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

multiAttack.text: The weretiger makes two attacks, using Scratch or Longbow in any combination. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Bite (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13. Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a Weretiger under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points. Success: The target is immune to this weretiger's curse for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Scratch
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

bonusActions.name: Prowl (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
bonusActions.text: The weretiger moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. At the end of this movement, the weretiger can take the Hide action.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The weretiger shape-shifts into a Large tiger-humanoid hybrid or a Large tiger, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

multiAttack.text: The wereboar makes two attacks, using Javelin or Tusk in any combination. It can replace one attack with a Gore attack.

attacks.name: Gore (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12. Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a Wereboar under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points. Success: The target is immune to this wereboar's curse for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Javelin (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

attacks.name: Tusk (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the wereboar moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The wereboar shape-shifts into a Medium boar-humanoid hybrid or a Small boar, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The two-headed plesiosaurus has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The plesiosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

multiAttack.text: The two-headed plesiosaurus makes two bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage.

multiAttack.text: The thessalhydra makes one maw attack and one Flurry of Bites.

attacks.name: Flurry of Bites
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (4d4) poison damage.

attacks.name: Maw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) acid damage.

attacks.name: Tail Pincer
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage, and the target is grappled. As an action, the target can escape the grapple by succeeding on a DC 14 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (its choice). Until this grapple ends, the thessalhydra can't use its tail pincer.

special.name: Acid Saliva
special.text: The thessalhydra spits a glob of acid at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Detect
actions.text: The thessalhydra makes a Wisdom (Perception) check with advantage.
