actions.name: Tail Swipe
actions.text: The thessalhydra makes a tail pincer attack.

traits.name: Stirge Telepathy
traits.text: The strigoi can magically command any stirge within 120 feet of it, using a limited form of telepathy.

multiAttack.text: The strigoi makes one Claw attack and makes one Proboscis attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 6 (1d12) acid damage.

attacks.name: Proboscis
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the strigoi regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. A creature reduced to 0 hit points from this attack dies and leaves nothing behind except its skin and its equipment.

special.name: Ravenous Children (1/Day)
special.text: The strigoi magically summons 1d4 + 2 stirges (see their entry in the Monster Manual) in unoccupied spaces it can see within 30 feet of it. The stirges are under the strigoi's control and act immediately after the strigoi in the initiative order. The stirges disappear after 1 hour, when the strigoi dies, or when the strigoi dismisses them (no action required).

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) piercing damage.

traits.name: Raking Charge
traits.text: If the kavu moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the kavu can make one rend attack against it as a bonus action.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points by a creature that is Large or smaller, the draconian crumbles into dust that then forms a spectral, shrieking image of the creature that killed it. The image lasts for 1 minute. Each creature hostile to the draconian within 10 feet of the image must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the spectral image for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

attacks.name: Serrated Sword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Shape Theft
reactions.text: After the draconian kills a Medium or smaller Humanoid, the draconian magically cloaks itself in an illusion to look and feel like that creature while retaining the draconian's game statistics (other than its size). This transformation lasts until the draconian dies or uses a bonus action to end it.

traits.name: Invisible in Fire
traits.text: The oread is invisible while fully immersed in fire.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The oread has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The oread's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: fire bolt (see "Actions" below) 3 times per day: burning hands 1/day each: hellish rebuke (see "Reactions" below), scorching ray

multiAttack.text: The oread attacks twice with its fiery touch or fire bolt.

attacks.name: Fiery Touch
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage.

attacks.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

reactions.name: Hellish Rebuke (2nd-Level Spell; 1/Day)
reactions.text: When the oread is damaged by a creature within 60 feet of the oread that it can see, the creature that damaged the oread must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oread's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The merrow can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: The merrow is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The merrow has the following druid spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, minor illusion, shocking grasp 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, fog cloud, thunderwave 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, mirror image, misty step 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, lightning bolt (see "Actions" below), sleet storm

attacks.name: Harpoon
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the merrow can pull it 10 feet closer.

special.name: Lightning Bolt (3rd-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
special.text: The merrow unleashes a stroke of lightning in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merrow is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The merrow has the following druid spells prepared:

traits.name: Industrious
traits.text: The leprechaun is proficient with all artisan's tools and adds double its proficiency bonus to ability checks made with them.

traits.name: Reluctant Refusal
traits.text: When a creature offers the leprechaun the chance to partake in merriment or revelry such as a song, a dance, or a good meal, the leprechaun must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the charmed condition for 24 hours. While charmed in this way, the leprechaun partakes of the offering, treats the creature as a trusted friend, and seeks to defend it from harm. The charmed condition ends if the creature or any of its allies damage the leprechaun, force the leprechaun to make a saving throw, or steal from the leprechaun.

multiAttack.text: The leprechaun makes two Cobbler's Hammer attacks and can use Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Cobbler's Hammer
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) force damage. If the target is a creature, its speed is halved until the start of the leprechaun's next turn.

special.name: Gift of Luck (1/Day)
special.text: The leprechaun touches a creature and magically gifts the target a measure of luck. The creature gains the leprechaun's Astonishing Luck reaction. The creature can use the reaction three times, after which this gift goes away. The leprechaun can revoke this gift from a creature at any time (no action required). A creature can benefit from only one leprechaun's Gift of Luck at a time.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The leprechaun casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: Mending (as an action), Prestidigitation 2/day each: Invisibility, Phantasmal Force 1/day each: Fabricate (as an action), Mislead

bonusActions.name: Cunning Trick
bonusActions.text: The leprechaun takes the Disengage or Hide action or makes a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check.

reactions.name: Astonishing Luck
reactions.text: When the leprechaun fails an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, it can roll a new d20 and choose which roll to use, potentially turning the failure into a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The leprechaun casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The kamadan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the kamadan moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is knocked prone, the kamadan can make two attacksone with its bite and one with its snakesagainst it as a bonus action.

multiAttack.text: The kamadan makes two attacks: one with its bite or claw and one with its snakes.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Snakes
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Sleep Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The kamadan exhales sleep gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if it takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

traits.name: Army Arcana
traits.text: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

multiAttack.text: The hobgoblin makes two Quarterstaff or Devastating Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Quarterstaff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) force damage.

attacks.name: Devastating Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) force damage, and the target is knocked prone.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: mage hand, prestidigitation 2/day each: fireball, fly, fog cloud, gust of wind, lightning bolt

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The hippopotamus makes two Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Piercing damage.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.text: If the hippopotamus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the hippopotamus can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.text: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

multiAttack.text: The wolf makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage.

multiAttack.text: The girallon makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Aggressive
bonusActions.text: The girallon moves up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The walrus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The walrus makes two attacks: one with its body flop and one with its tusks.

attacks.name: Body Flop
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Tusks
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) piercing damage.

multiAttack.text: The lizard makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. One attack can be replaced by Swallow.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizard can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the lizard. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature the lizard is grappling. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage. The target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the lizard, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the lizard's turns. The lizard can have only one target swallowed at a time.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the target begins to hallucinate and is afflicted with a effect (determined randomly or by the DM; see "Madness" in chapter 8 of the ). The effect lasts 10 minutes.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the hag fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Trace the Threads (1/Day)
traits.text: The hag can cast the Legend Lore spell, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

multiAttack.text: The hag makes two Shears attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Shears
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the hag's next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: While holding its shears, the hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: Bless, Guidance, Silent Image 1/day each: Bane, Bestow Curse, Divination, Scrying (as an action)

actions.name: Destined Jaunt
actions.text: The hag magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself.

actions.name: Tangle Threads
actions.text: The hag magically tangles a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself in spectral silver threads. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Destiny Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The hag magically curses a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, and the creature has disadvantage on this save if it has damaged the hag within the last minute. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the curse ends. Once per turn, when the cursed creature fails one of those d20 rolls, it takes 7 (2d6) force damage. The curse ends after 1 minute; when the creature succeeds on a total of three ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws in any combination; or when the hag uses this action again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: While holding its shears, the hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

multiAttack.text: The elephant makes two Gore attacks.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature and the elephant moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the Prone condition.

bonusActions.name: Trample
bonusActions.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature within 5 feet that has the Prone condition. Failure: 17 (2d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. Success: Half damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it bursts into flames and is reduced to ashes. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the draconian must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

attacks.name: Serrated Sword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Shape Theft
reactions.text: After the draconian kills a Medium or smaller Humanoid, the draconian can magically transform itself to look and feel like that creature while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation lasts until the draconian dies or uses an action to end it.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The demogorgon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The demogorgon has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The demogorgon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the demogorgon takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the demogorgon's next turn. The demogorgon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

multiAttack.text: The demogorgon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The decapus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tentacles.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature grappled by the decapus. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Tentacles

conditional.condition: the decapus is grappling a creature other than the target or if the decapus is on the ground or floor

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (9d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage or 14 (5d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage if the decapus is grappling a creature other than the target or if the decapus is on the ground or floor. The target is also grappled (escape DC 14) unless the decapus is already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.text: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

multiAttack.text: The bullywug makes two Bog Staff attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Ray of Sickness.

attacks.name: Bog Staff
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The bullywug casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Dancing Lights, Druidcraft, Ray of Sickness 1/day each: Speak with Plants, Vitriolic Sphere

bonusActions.name: Leap
bonusActions.text: The bullywug can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bullywug casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The scavver doesn't require air.

attacks.name: Swallowing Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the scavver. The scavver can have one creature swallowed at a time.

traits.name: Pack Leader
traits.text: The aurumvorax's allies have advantage on attack rolls while within 10 feet of the aurumvorax, provided it isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The aurumvorax can burrow through solid rock and metal at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

multiAttack.text: The aurumvorax makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature wearing armor of any type, the aurumvorax gains one of the following benefits of its choice:

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the aurumvorax can't use its Claw attack on another target, and when it moves, it can drag the grappled creature with it, without the aurumvorax's speed being halved.

special.name: Frenzy
special.text: The aurumvorax has advantage on attack rolls until start of its next turn.

special.name: Invigorate
special.text: The aurumvorax regains 6 (1d8 + 2) hit points.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) piercing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The archelon can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The archelon makes two Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: animal friendship (snakes only), eldritch blast (2 beams), minor illusion, poison spray 3 times per day: suggestion

multiAttack.text: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can constrict only once.

attacks.name: Bite (Snake Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

attacks.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
headerEntries: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The young horizonback tortoise can breathe air and water.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.text: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

multiAttack.text: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two greatsword attacks.

attacks.name: Frost Brand Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

special.name: Chilling Gaze
special.text: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.text: If the yeti takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

multiAttack.text: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two attacks, using Claw or Ice Throw in any combination.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Cold damage.

attacks.name: Ice Throw
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Cold damage.

special.name: Chilling Gaze
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature the yeti can see within 30 feet. Failure: 5 (2d4) Cold damage, and the target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the yeti's next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage. Success: The target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

traits.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.text: The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.

multiAttack.text: The yakfolk makes two attacks, either with its greatsword or its longbow.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

traits.name: Ethereal Jaunt
traits.text: As a bonus action, a xill can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

traits.name: Poison Stinger
traits.text: The xill injects poison into one creature it hit with its claws this turn. The chosen creature must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, with disadvantage if the xill hit it more than once this turn, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned this way.

multiAttack.text: The xill makes four claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The wolf has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

special.name: Cold Breath
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. Failure: 18 (4d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The werewolf has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the werewolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The werewolf makes two attacks, using Scratch or Longbow in any combination. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12. Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a Werewolf under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points. Success: The target is immune to this werewolf's curse for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Scratch
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The werewolf shape-shifts into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or a Medium wolf, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The serpentfolk can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The serpentfolk's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: animal friendship, speak with animals (snakes only) once per day: pass without trace 2/day each: sleep, suggestion

multiAttack.text: The serpentfolk makes two scimitar attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Scimitar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the serpentfolk can't constrict another target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The serpentfolk's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The impersonator can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.text: In the first round of a combat, the impersonator has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.text: If the impersonator surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

multiAttack.text: The impersonator makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Read Thoughts
special.text: The impersonator magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the impersonator can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the impersonator's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the impersonator has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The two-headed owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: When one of the owlbear's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

multiAttack.text: The two-headed owlbear makes three attacks: two with its beaks and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the trapper is motionless on a floor, wall, or ceiling at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the trapper move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the trapper isn't part of the floor, wall, or ceiling.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The trapper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

special.name: Smother
special.text: One Large or smaller creature within 10 feet of the trapper must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 14). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. While grappled in this way, the target is restrained, blinded, and deprived of air. The trapper can smother only one creature at a time.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The sword spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the sword spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The sword spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

multiAttack.text: The sword spider makes one Bite attack and two Foreleg attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and has the paralyzed condition while poisoned in this way.

attacks.name: Foreleg
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

traits.name: Skeletonize
traits.text: If the swarm starts its turn in the same space as a dead creature that is Large or smaller, the corpse is destroyed, leaving behind only equipment and bones (or exoskeleton).

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

attacks.name: Ravenous Bites

conditional.condition: the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, scarabs burrow into its body, and the creature takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. Any creature can use an action to kill or remove the scarabs with fire or a weapon that deals piercing damage, causing 1 damage of the appropriate type to the target. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the swarm's piercing damage dies.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The ssurran can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

traits.name: Intellect Fortress
traits.text: The ssurran's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

multiAttack.text: The ssurran makes two Claw attacks and uses Defile (if available).

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

special.name: Defile
special.text: Ordinary vegetation within 10 feet of the ssurran withers and dies. In addition, each creature within 10 feet of the ssurran must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The ssurran regains 5 (1d10) hit points for each creature that fails the saving throw.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The ssurran casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible) once per day: invisibility (self only)

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the lion moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the lion can make another Rend attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Keen Sight and Smell
traits.text: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

multiAttack.text: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The sludge hag can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The sludge hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: At will: acid splash, dancing lights, minor illusion The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

attacks.name: Sludge Slap
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (1d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 (1d8) acid damage. Sludge Slap does both bludgeoning and acid damage

special.name: False Appearance
special.text: The sludge hag collapses into a oily pool of sludge. While motionless, the sludge hag is indistinguishable from any other oily pool of oozy drippiness.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
footerEntries: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

traits.name: Amphibious

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

attacks.name: Shortbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

special.name: Sirene's Song (2/Day)
special.text: The sirene casts suggestion with a range of 1 mile that affects all creatures of the sirene's choosing in range. Each target has disadvantage on the saving throw.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The sirene casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): 1/day each: crown of madness, fog cloud, invisibility

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Ethereal Awareness
traits.text: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.text: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special.name: Terrifying Howl
special.text: The shadow mastiff howls. Any Beast or Humanoid within 300 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any shadow mastiff's Terrifying Howl for the next 24 hours.

bonusActions.name: Shadow Blend
bonusActions.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow mastiff becomes invisible, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the shadow mastiff uses a bonus action to end it or until the shadow mastiff attacks, is in bright light, or is incapacitated.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The serpopard has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the serpopard moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the serpopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Seething
traits.text: Once it enters combat, the swarm deals 10 slashing damage to itself at the end of its turn if it did not make an attack on that turn. This damage ignores resistance, and it cannot reduce the swarm to 0 hit points.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

attacks.name: Bites

conditional.condition: the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.text: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.text: The hook horror can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.text: The hook horror has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

multiAttack.text: The hook horror makes two hook attacks.

attacks.name: Hook
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.text: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.text: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

multiAttack.text: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.text: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

speedConditions.walk: (in elf form; 40 ft. in fox and hybrid form)

multiAttack.text: The werefox makes two Bite attacks, two Lance attacks, or one Bite attack and one Lance attack.

attacks.name: Bite (Fox or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the werefox moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit and the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

attacks.name: Lance (Elf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Entangling Arrow (Elf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or have the restrained condition until the start of the werefox's next turn.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The werefox polymorphs into a fox-elf hybrid, into a fox, or back into its elf form. Its game statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its elf form if it dies.

bonusActions.name: Vulpine Nimbleness (Fox or Hybrid Form Only)
bonusActions.text: The werefox takes the Dash or Disengage action.

traits.name: Iron Boots
traits.text: The redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Outsize Strength
traits.text: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

multiAttack.text: The redcap makes three Wicked Sickle attacks.

attacks.name: Wicked Sickle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Ironbound Pursuit
special.text: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

traits.name: Bloodied Fury
traits.text: While Bloodied, the quaggoth has Advantage on attack rolls.

multiAttack.text: The quaggoth makes two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 5 (2d4) Psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The quaggoth casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At will: Mage Hand (the hand is Invisible), Minor Illusion 2 times per day: Mind Spike

reactions.name: Psionic Defense (3/Day)
reactions.text: The quaggoth casts Feather Fall or Shield in response to the spell's trigger, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. 3 times per day: Feather Fall, Shield

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.text: The spider can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane and vice versa.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the spider knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

multiAttack.text: The spider makes two Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Poison damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target becomes Stable, and it has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. While Poisoned, the target also has the Paralyzed condition.

bonusActions.name: Ethereal Jaunt
bonusActions.text: The spider teleports from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice versa.

multiAttack.text: The owlbear makes two Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Abyssal Glaive
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 10 ft. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the minotaur moved 10+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

multiAttack.text: The manticore makes three attacks, using Rend or Tail Spike in any combination.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail Spike
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range 100/200 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.text: The leucrotta can mimic Beast sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Stench
traits.text: Any creature other than a leucrotta or gnoll that starts its turn within 5 feet of the leucrotta must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all leucrottas for 1 hour.

multiAttack.text: The leucrotta makes one Bite attack and one Hooves attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the leucrotta scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

attacks.name: Hooves
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

bonusActions.name: Kicking Retreat
bonusActions.text: Immediately after the leucrotta makes a Hooves attack, it takes the Disengage action.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

multiAttack.text: The mimic makes three attacks: two with its pseudopods and one with its bite.

attacks.name: Pseudopod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

traits.name: Corpse Stride
traits.text: Once on its turn, the lampad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one creature's corpse within its reach and emerge from a second creature's corpse within 60 feet of the first corpse, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second corpse. Both corpses must be Medium or bigger.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The lampad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The lampad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (+6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), gentle repose

multiAttack.text: The lampad attacks twice with its necrotic touch or chill touch.

attacks.name: Necrotic Touch
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the lampad's next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the lampad until the end of the lampad's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
