traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it dissolves into acid that splashes on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature.

traits.name: Glide
traits.text: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dagger
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The simulacrum can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.text: In the first round of a combat, the simulacrum has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.text: If the simulacrum surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

multiAttack.text: The simulacrum makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Read Thoughts
special.text: The simulacrum magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the simulacrum can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the simulacrum's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the simulacrum has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

multiAttack.text: The hook horror makes two Hook attacks.

attacks.name: Hook
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 10 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the hook horror moves the target 5 feet straight toward or away from itself.

traits.name: Aura of Authority
traits.text: While in a 10-foot Emanation originating from the hobgoblin, the hobgoblin and its allies have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws, provided the hobgoblin doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The hobgoblin makes two attacks, using Greatsword or Longbow in any combination.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) Poison damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.text: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

traits.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
traits.text: While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves: 1st level (4 slots): charm person, witch bolt 2nd level (3 slots): alter self, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, glyph of warding, slow 4th level (3 slots): blight, polymorph 5th level (2 slots): dominate person, seeming 6th level (1 slot): Otto's irresistible dance For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Illusory Appearance
special.text: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

special.name: Invisible Passage
special.text: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
headerEntries: While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.text: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Coven Magic
traits.text: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

multiAttack.text: The hag makes two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Dancing Lights, Disguise Self (24-hour duration), Invisibility (self only, and the hag leaves no tracks while Invisible), Minor Illusion, Ray of Sickness (level 3 version)

spellcasting.name: Coven Magic
headerEntries: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks):

will: Invisibility (self only, and the hag leaves no tracks while Invisible)

multiAttack.text: The goblin makes two Hex Stick attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Hex Stick
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The goblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: Minor Illusion 1/day each: Blindness/Deafness, Faerie Fire, Grease

reactions.name: Jinx

components.trigger: A creature the goblin can see hits it with an attack roll.

reactions.text: Trigger: A creature the goblin can see hits it with an attack roll. ResponseWisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, the triggering creature. Failure: The attack misses instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The goblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The turtle can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Stable
traits.text: Whenever an effect knocks the turtle prone, it can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked prone. A prone turtle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The slug has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The slug can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The slug's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 1/day each: guiding bolt, sanctuary, spiritual weapon

multiAttack.text: The slug makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

attacks.name: Tentacles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Animate Tentacle
reactions.text: When the slug takes damage in this cave (24. Shrine of Umberlee), it can use its reaction to animate one of the tentacles of the kraken statue and cause it to make a melee weapon attack (+3 to hit) against one creature within 20 feet of the statue that the slug can see. The tentacle deals 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage on a hit.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slug's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

multiAttack.text: The scorpion makes two Claw attacks and one Sting attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 13) from one of two claws.

attacks.name: Sting
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) Poison damage.

name: Giant Ox
languages: understands Giant and Sylvan but can't speak

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.text: The ox is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage. If the ox moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage, and it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The eel can breathe only underwater.

multiAttack.text: The eel makes two bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage.

special.name: Lightning Jolt
special.text: One creature the eel touches within 5 feet of it outside water, or each creature within 15 feet of it in a body of water, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On failed save, a target takes 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the target takes any of this damage, the target is stunned until the end of the eel's next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The toad can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Cold Aura
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the toad takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.text: The toad's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the toad can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature the toad is grappling. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and 11 (2d10) cold damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time.

name: Giant Goose
languages: understands Giant and Sylvan but can't speak

multiAttack.text: The goose makes one Beak attack and two Wing attacks.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Wing
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

special.name: Thunderous Honk
special.text: The goose honks with ear-splitting volume. Each other creature within 30 feet of the goose must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 16 (3d10) thunder damage and has the deafened condition until the start of the goose's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The honk can be heard within 300 feet.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The forlarren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The forlarren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: expeditious retreat, false life, minor illusion, prestidigitation 3/day each: aid, misty step, Tasha's hideous laughter 1/day each: heal, heat metal, mirror image

multiAttack.text: The forlarren makes two claw attacks and one gore attack, or it makes three chromatic ray attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Chromatic Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) lightning damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The forlarren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Running Leap
traits.text: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

traits.name: Spell Turning
traits.text: The lion has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the lion (not an area). If the lion's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the lion and instead targets the caster.

multiAttack.text: The lion makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: The lion makes one claw attack.

actions.name: Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The lion emits a magical roar. Each creature within 60 feet of the lion that can hear the roar must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the lion until the end of the lion's next turn.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

attacks.name: Greataxe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

special.name: Burning Breath
special.text: The minotaur exhales a cloud of burning embers in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

multiAttack.text: The grafter makes one Claw attack and one Greatclub attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

attacks.name: Greatclub
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Acid Retch
special.text: The grafter retches forth a spray of acidic bile in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the subject is reduced to 0 hit points, it dissolves into acid that splashes on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the subject must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature.

traits.name: Glide
traits.text: When the subject falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be infected with a diseasea minuscule slaad egg.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into a puddle of acid and splashes acid on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Glide
traits.text: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dagger
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

multiAttack.text: The doppelganger makes two Slam attacks and uses Unsettling Visage if available.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6 (with Advantage during the first round of each combat), reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Unsettling Visage
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the doppelganger that can see the doppelganger. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

special.name: Read Thoughts
special.text: The doppelganger casts Detect Thoughts, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12). At will: Detect Thoughts

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The doppelganger shape-shifts into a Medium or Small Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

spellcasting.name: Read Thoughts
headerEntries: The doppelganger casts Detect Thoughts, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12).

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

multiAttack.text: The dolphin makes two Dazzling Slam attacks.

attacks.name: Dazzling Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the dolphin's next turn.

bonusActions.name: Delightful Light
bonusActions.text: The dolphin magically emanates light in a 10-foot radius for a moment. The dolphin and each creature of its choice in that light gain 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

bonusActions.name: Fey Leap
bonusActions.text: The dolphin teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Immediately before teleporting, the dolphin can choose one creature within 5 feet of it. That creature can teleport with the dolphin, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the dolphin's destination space.

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.text: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.text: Attack rolls against the displacer beast have Disadvantage, since it projects an illusion that makes it appear to be near its actual location. This trait is suppressed while the displacer beast has the Incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The displacer beast makes one Rend attack and one Tentacle attack.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 feet. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage. If target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 10 feet. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

multiAttack.text: The mimic can make three attacks; two with its pseudopods and one with its bite

attacks.name: Pseudopod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

speedConditions.walk: (20 ft. and swim 40 ft. in hybrid form)

traits.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
traits.text: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The deep scion makes two Battleaxe attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Battleaxe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

attacks.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The deep scion transforms into a hybrid form (humanoid-piscine) or back into its true form, which is humanlike. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mimicry (Green Hag)
traits.text: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery The hag's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells:

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Illusory Appearance
special.text: The hag covers herself with a magical illusion that allows her to look like another creature of her general size and shape. The illusion ends when the hag chooses, or if she dies. A DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check will expose the hag's disguise.

special.name: Invisible Passage
special.text: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends. While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, and can only be tracked by magic.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
footerEntries: The hag's spellcasting ability is Charisma
(spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells:

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the chupacabra has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Drain Blood
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is prone, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the chupacabra regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

reactions.name: Pin
reactions.text: If a creature within 5 feet of the chupacabra stands up, the chupacabra can use its reaction to make a bite attack.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the choldrith to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

attacks.name: Dagger
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Web
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The choldrith casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At will: guidance, thaumaturgy 1/day each: bane, hold person

bonusActions.name: Spectral Dagger (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonusActions.text: The choldrith conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The choldrith can make a melee spell attack (+4 to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 6 (1d8 + 2) force damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The choldrith casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):

traits.name: Flammable Blood
traits.text: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The cave fisher makes two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

special.name: Retract Filament
special.text: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the cave fisher's Adhesive Filament must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes one Claw attack against it. Anyone else who was attached to the filament is released. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't use Adhesive Filament.

bonusActions.name: Adhesive Filament
bonusActions.text: The cave fisher extends a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature the filament adheres to is grappled by the cave fisher (escape DC 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). A weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful DC 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher. The filament crumbles away if the cave fisher takes this bonus action again.

multiAttack.text: The carrion stalker makes three Tentacle attacks. If it is attached to a creature, it can replace one Tentacle attack with Larval Burst, if available.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the carrion stalker attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the carrion stalker moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.

special.name: Larval Burst (1/Day)
special.text: The carrion stalker releases a burst of larvae in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. A creature poisoned in this way takes 7 (2d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as larvae infest its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease or removes the poisoned condition instantly kills the larvae in the creature, ending the effect on it. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by the infestation, it dies. The larvae remain in the corpse, and one survives to become a fully grown carrion stalker in 1d4 weeks. Any effect that cures diseases or removes the poisoned condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the larvae.

traits.name: Abduct
traits.text: The bugbear needn't spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

multiAttack.text: The bugbear makes two Javelin or Morningstar attacks.

attacks.name: Javelin
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 10 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

attacks.name: Morningstar
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5 (with Advantage if the target is Grappled by the bugbear), reach 10 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

bonusActions.name: Quick Grapple
bonusActions.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, one Medium or smaller creature the bugbear can see within 10 feet. Failure: The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 13).

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If Antigonos moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.text: Antigonos can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of his turn, Antigonos can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

traits.name: Decrepit State
traits.text: Antigonos has disadvantage on his attack rolls.

attacks.name: Greataxe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Amphora
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If there is not already a creature inside the amphora, the target is restrained inside. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 14 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, escaping from the amphora on a success. The effect also ends if the amphora is destroyed. The amphora has AC 8, 20 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

traits.name: Bladed Hide
traits.text: At the start of each of its turns, the moorbounder deals 5 (2d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.text: The moorbounder's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

multiAttack.text: The moorbounder makes two attacks: one with its blades and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Blades
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

bonusActions.name: Petrifying Gaze
bonusActions.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. If the basilisk sees its reflection within the Cone, the basilisk must make this save. First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the moose moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.text: The moose has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

multiAttack.text: The moose makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

attacks.name: Antlers
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Hooves
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The assassin bug has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

multiAttack.text: The assassin bug makes two bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned this way, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

attacks.name: Ovipositor
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: The target is infested with 1d3 assassin bug eggs, which immediately hatch into assassin bug maggots. At the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 1d6 piercing damage per maggot infesting it. Applying fire to the bite wound before the end of the target's next turn deals 1 fire damage to the target and kills these assassin bug maggots. After this time, the maggots are too far under the skin to be burned.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The ankylosaurus makes two Tail attacks.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 10 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

multiAttack.text: The amphisbaena makes two attacks, only one of which can be a constrict attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can't constrict another target.

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.text: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

multiAttack.text: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

special.name: Chilling Gaze
special.text: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the broodguard can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

multiAttack.text: The broodguard makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the bulette moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

multiAttack.text: The wererat makes two attacks, using Scratch or Hand Crossbow in any combination. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11. Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a Wererat under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points. Success: The target is immune to this wererat's curse for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Scratch
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The wererat shape-shifts into a Medium rat-humanoid hybrid or a Small rat, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.text: As a bonus action, the cerberus can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Multiheaded
traits.text: The cerberus can't be surprised, and it has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cerberus's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

multiAttack.text: The cerberus makes two bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

special.name: Breath Weapon
special.text: The cerberus exhales a 15-foot cone of molten rock. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is also restrained by the hardening rock. A creature can make a DC 12 Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 10 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.text: The timbermaw has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

multiAttack.text: The timbermaw makes one attack with its tentacles. If that attack hits, the timbermaw can make one beak attack against the same target.

attacks.name: Tentacles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

multiAttack.text: The thri-kreen makes two Gythka or Chatkcha attacks.

attacks.name: Gythka
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Chatkcha
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Chameleon Carapace
bonusActions.text: The thri-kreen changes the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings, gaining advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes to hide in those surroundings.

bonusActions.name: Leap
bonusActions.text: The thri-kreen leaps up to 20 feet in any direction, provided its speed isn't 0.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: The thri-kreen adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the thri-kreen must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

attacks.name: Bites
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damageor 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodiedplus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

attacks.name: Swarm of Proboscises
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) Piercing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodied. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature in the swarm's space, the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 13). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

attacks.name: Infestation

conditional.condition: the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. A creature damaged by the swarm must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or contract a disease.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the swarm is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the swarm move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the swarm is animate.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

attacks.name: Swarm of Bites

conditional.condition: the swarm is at half of its hit points or fewer

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage if the swarm is at half of its hit points or fewer, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

bonusActions.name: Scale Dust (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: The swarm releases magical glittering dust from its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the swarm must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be outlined in blue light for 10 minutes. While outlined in this way, a creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from being invisible. In addition, every Dragon within 1 mile of the creature becomes aware of it and can unerringly track the creature. Casting dispel magic on the creature ends the effect on it.

traits.name: Limited Spell Immunity
traits.text: The swarm automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 3rd level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny gremishka. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

attacks.name: Bites

conditional.condition: the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

reactions.name: Spell Redirection
reactions.text: In response to a spell attack roll missing the swarm, the swarm causes that spell to hit another creature of its choice within 30 feet of it that it can see.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Talons
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The serpent can hold its breath for 1 hour.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The shark has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

multiAttack.text: The shark makes two bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Ethereal Awareness
traits.text: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.text: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

bonusActions.name: Shadow Blend
bonusActions.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow mastiff becomes invisible, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the shadow mastiff uses a bonus action to end it or until the shadow mastiff attacks, is in bright light, or is incapacitated.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Vile Appearance
traits.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 11, any Beast or Humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to this hag's Vile Appearance for 24 hours.

traits.name: Coven Magic
traits.text: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

special.name: Death Glare
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 11, one Frightened creature the hag can see within 30 feet. Failure: If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, it drops to 0 Hit Points. Otherwise, the target takes 13 (3d8) Psychic damage.

special.name: Illusory Appearance
special.text: The hag casts Disguise Self, using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13). The spell's duration is 24 hours. At will: Disguise Self

spellcasting.name: Coven Magic
headerEntries: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

spellcasting.name: Illusory Appearance
headerEntries: The hag casts Disguise Self, using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13). The spell's duration is 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sleepless Reveler
traits.text: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

multiAttack.text: The satyr makes three ram attacks or three shortbow attacks.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Shortbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

special.name: Hail of Arrows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The satyr fires an arrow that magically transforms into a flurry of missiles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Running Leap
traits.text: With a 10-foot running start, the tiger can Long Jump up to 25 feet.

multiAttack.text: The tiger makes two Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Nimble Escape
bonusActions.text: The tiger takes the Disengage or Hide action.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

attacks.name: Pseudopod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the serpent can't constrict another target.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage. If target is a Large or smaller creature and the rhinoceros moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). The relic sloth can grapple no more than two targets at a time.

reactions.name: Slow but Sturdy
reactions.text: When the relic sloth is subjected to an effect that would move it out of its current space or knock it prone, it is neither moved nor knocked prone.

name: Reduced-Threat Peryton
languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Dive Attack
traits.text: If the peryton is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage to the target.

traits.name: Flyby

The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 9 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, is vulnerable to fire damage and immune to bludgeoning, poison and psychic damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The nereid can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Aquatic Invisibility
traits.text: If immersed in water, the nereid can make itself invisible as a bonus action. It remains invisible until it leaves the water, ends the invisibility as a bonus action, or dies.

traits.name: Mantle Dependent
traits.text: The nereid wears a mantle of silky cloth the color of sea foam, which holds the creature's spirit. The mantle has an AC and hit points equal to that of the nereid, but the garment can't be directly harmed while the nereid wears it. If the mantle is destroyed, the nereid becomes poisoned and dies within 1 hour. A nereid is willing to do anything in its power to recover the mantle if it is stolen, including serving the thief.

traits.name: Shape Water
traits.text: The nereid can cast control water at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma. This use of the spell has a range of 30 feet and can affect a cube of water no larger than 30 feet on a side.

traits.name: Speak With Animals
traits.text: The nereid can comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts.

attacks.name: Blinding Acid
attacks.text: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) acid damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the nereid's next turn.

special.name: Drowning Kiss
special.text: The nereid touches one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) acid damage. On a failure, it also runs out of breath and can't speak for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Water Lash
special.text: The nereid causes a 5-foot cube of water within 60 feet of it to take a shape of its choice and strike one target it can see within 5 feet of that water. The target must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and if it is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line or is knocked prone (nereid's choice). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting

While a creature is wreathed in light, attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature can't benefit from the invisible condition.

special.name: Spellcasting

bonusActions.name: Guiding Light (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: The faerie summons a 30-foot-radius sphere of magical light centered on itself, which lasts for 1 minute or until the faerie has the incapacitated condition. Each creature of the faerie's choice (other than the faerie) that starts its turn in that area gains 5 temporary hit points and has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and Wisdom checks until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the ettercap knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

multiAttack.text: The ettercap makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the ettercap's next turn.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

special.name: Web Strand
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 12, one Large or smaller creature the ettercap can see within 30 feet. Failure: The target has the Restrained condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage).

bonusActions.name: Reel
bonusActions.text: The ettercap pulls one creature within 30 feet of itself that is Restrained by its Web Strand up to 25 feet straight toward itself.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: The tentacle can reach anywhere in the room.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 35 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the tentacle can't constrict another target.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the eldritch horror hatchling can bite only the grappled creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

special.name: Acid Spray
special.text: The eldritch horror hatchling spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide, provided that it has no creature grappled. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The egg hunter makes two Egg Tooth attacks.

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 17 (4d6 + 3) piercing damage if the target is an object.

bonusActions.name: Rapid Movement
bonusActions.text: The egg hunter takes the Dash or Disengage action.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away and its bones explode. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

traits.name: Glide
traits.text: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

multiAttack.text: The draconian makes two Trident or Necrotic Ray attacks.

conditional.condition: used with two hands to make a melee attack

attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

attacks.name: Necrotic Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

traits.name: Tunneler

Until this grapple ends, the aurumvorax can't use its Claw attack on another target, and when it moves, it can drag the grappled creature with it, without the aurumvorax's speed being halved.

On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

The charmed condition ends for the creature after 1 hour, if it takes any damage, if the satyr attacks the target, or if the target witnesses the satyr attacking or damaging any of the target's allies.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the ram moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The ram has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.text: The ram has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that would knock it prone.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

traits.name: Nilbogism
traits.text: Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.

attacks.name: Fool's Scepter
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Mocking Word
special.text: The nilbog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At will: mage hand, Tasha's hideous laughter

bonusActions.name: Nimble Escape
bonusActions.text: The nilbog takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reactions.name: Reversal of Fortune
reactions.text: In response to another creature dealing damage to the nilbog, the nilbog reduces the damage to 0 and regains 3 (1d6) hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.text: The moorbounder's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The merrow can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The merrow makes two Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Garrote
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target of the meazel's size or smaller. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13 with disadvantage). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the meazel's turns. The meazel can't make weapon attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

attacks.name: Shortsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage

special.name: Shadow Teleport
special.text: The meazel, any equipment it is wearing or carrying, and any creature it is grappling teleport to an unoccupied space within 500 feet of it, provided that the starting space and the destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination must be a place the meazel has seen before, but it need not be within line of sight. If the destination space is occupied, the teleportation leads to the nearest unoccupied space. Any other creature the meazel teleports becomes cursed for 1 hour or until the curse is ended by remove curse or greater restoration. Until this curse ends, every Undead and every creature native to the Shadowfell within 300 feet of the cursed creature can sense it, which prevents that creature from hiding from them.

bonusActions.name: Shadow Stealth
bonusActions.text: While in dim light or darkness, the meazel takes the Hide action.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The lion has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Running Leap
traits.text: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can Long Jump up to 25 feet.

multiAttack.text: The lion makes two Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Roar.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

special.name: Roar
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 11, one creature within 15 feet. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of the lion's next turn.

name: Large Drake
languages: understands Common and Auran but can't speak them

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The drake has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The drake makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the toad takes 3 (1d6) cold damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) cold damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is grappled (escape DC 11). Until this grapple ends, the toad can't bite another target.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

attacks.name: Icy Web
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing, and takes 1 cold damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to poison, and psychic damage).

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.text: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Cloak of Shadows
traits.text: The hound appears with a number of temporary hit points equal to half your sorcerer level.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The hound can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The hound takes 5 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Omen Sight
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. If the target was hidden, it is no longer hidden from the hound.

traits.name: Ever at Your Heels
traits.text: On its turn, it can move only toward its target by the most direct route, and it can use its action only to attack its target. The hound can make opportunity attacks, but only against its target. Additionally, while the hound is within 5 feet of the target, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against any spell you cast. The hound disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points, if its target is reduced to 0 hit points, or after 5 minutes.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.text: The homarid can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The hippogriff doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

multiAttack.text: The hippogriff makes two Rend attacks.

attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.
